item.title: Fortnite is Getting a Kendrick Lamar Emote, It’s Claimed
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/fortnite-is-getting-a-kendrick-lamar-emote-its-claimed/

A Popular Fortnite leaker has stated that the game could receive a new emote inspired by Kendrick Lamar’s song.

Fortnite leaker HYPEX’s new post on X talks about the upcoming Fortnite x Kendrick Lamar collaboration. The partnership will seemingly introduce a “Sit Down, Be Humble” bundle with an emote and song. The song will most likely be “Humble,” the Grammy-winning song by the American Rapper, which was released in 2017. The tweet also states that the “Emote might be from the girl in “Not Like Us. “ 

Many players will be excited to see Kendrick Lamar-inspired emotes arriving in the game. Some have also started speculating that the hip-hop artist could be a part of the next Fortnite Festival season. Others also wonder why Fortnite is going with a 2017 song when Kendrick Lamar’s ‘Not Like Us’ blew out of the stratosphere after his Super Bowl performance. 

However, previous leaks have already provided an idea about who Fortnite Festival’s next headliner will be, and it doesn’t seem like it is Kendrick Lamar. According to the leaks that arrived in January this year, the next artist could be none other than Sabrina Carpenter. The ‘Espresso’ singer is speculated to be the next Fortnite Festival Icon, which will bring new cosmetics and jam tracks inspired by the American artist. 

In other news, Fortnite is expected to introduce a new Lara Croft skin in this update. Also, cheaters with lifetime bans will receive a ‘second chance’ soon. What are your thoughts on Fortnite getting a Kendrick Lamar emote? Let us know in the comments or on our community forum!

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Rainbow Six Siege X UI, Skins and map details revealed through a new leak. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

Rockstar Games Parent Company Sues ‘GTA Online Black Market’ Provider

Take-Two, the parent company behind Rockstar Games, has sued PlayerAuctions, a provider of illegitimate GTA Online goods and services.

GDC Remove ‘Iron Man’ Reference From Electronic Arts Schedule Page

The scheduling page for Electronic Arts that suggested Iron Man was making an appearance at GDC has been updated to remove the reference.

EA Adds Microtransactions To Skate’s Closed Alpha

EA Skate has added microtransactions to the game while its still in a closed alpha state during playtests, Insider Gaming has learned.

Postal 2 Is Getting a VR Port 22 Years After Its Release

Developer Running with Scissors has announced Postal 2 VR, a full VR port of the controversial game from 2003.

item.title: Rockstar Games Parent Company Sues ‘GTA Online Black Market’ Provider
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/rockstar-games-parent-company-sues-gta-online/

Take-Two, the parent company behind Rockstar Games, has sued PlayerAuctions, a side that allegedly facilitates the sale of hacked and boosted GTA Online accounts and illegitimate in-game currency. The recent lawsuit was filed in California, with Take-Two claiming that the Chinese-owned PlayerAuctions platform was ‘reaping millions in revenue’ based on these sales.

The filing from the U.S. Central District Court of California insists that PlayerAuctions is being run with the ‘full knowledge that its sellers are engaged in rampant infringement and other unauthorised conduct.’

Not The First

It was revealed in February 2025 that the Roblox Corporation was also suing PlayerAuctions for a similar streak of allegations. As these cases ramp up, more developers and publishers may enter the fight, as PlayerAuctions supports the sale of digital goods and services from a staggering assortment of titles.

Everything from RuneScape and Fortnite to World of Warcraft and Call of Duty is featured on PlayerAuctions.

The Take-Two case, which was originally spotted by Polygon, offers an in-depth perspective on how PlayerAuctions operates and how it’s walking a fine legal line when it comes to digital goods in GTA Online.

The California court filing reads:

PlayerAuctions goes to great lengths to lull its users into buying illegitimate GTA V content from its sellers, including by offering ‘after-sale protection’ – i.e. refunds – if the hacked accounts they purchase are detected and banned by Take-Two’s anti-cheat systems.

PlayerAuctions offers this ‘protection’ because it knows the hacked player account listings on its marketplace are infringing and unauthorised under Take-Two’s terms of service.

It was stressed in the filing that Take-Two has sent several notices to PlayerAuctions along with evidence of these claims, but the platform’s operators have refused to relent. Per the statutory claims of the case, Take-Two would be entitled to $150,000 for each copyright infringed, but PlayerAuctions’ sales figures haven’t yet been made public.

It could be a monster case in terms of damages if Take-Two is successful.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that GDC’s team has removed an ‘Iron Man’ reference from their site

item.title: GDC Remove ‘Iron Man’ Reference From Electronic Arts Schedule Page
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/iron-man-motive-reference-gdc-removed/

Just a couple of days ago, I reported on a mention of Motive’s Iron Man being shown during a summit at GDC next week. Eagle-eyed gamers spotted this, and it set up assumptions that the game would be demo-ready for GDC, one of the biggest conferences in the gaming world.

Now, it has been noticed that the GDC admin team has removed the reference to Iron Man from the same schedule page, suggesting that the game either will no longer be shown or the team is attempting to ‘keep it a surprise.’

Iron Man No More

The schedule page promoting the Advanced Graphics Summit at GDC on March 17 originally spoke of a presentation concerning the development of texture sets for both Dead Space and Iron Man at EA’s Motive studio. This was covered in an article I published recently, but upon refreshing the page, it’s clear that the Iron Man reference has been removed.

Whether this was an editing mistake or something that shouldn’t have been revealed yet remains to be seen. In just a few days, GDC will kick off in San Francisco, and journalists will attend the summit to determine the truth of it.

Motive has been working on an Iron Man game since at least 2022, when we revealed that playtests for the title had already started. It has been relatively silent in terms of production updates since it was revealed, and even base imagery of the game hasn’t been revealed.

It hasn’t been a great time for superhero games of late, what with the collapse of Wonder Woman and the commercial failure of Suicide Squad, but that’s a problem for WB Games.

All we know so far is that Motive’s Iron Man will be a third-person, single-player title built in Unreal Engine 5.

Are you interested in picking up Iron Man when it eventually materialises? Let me know in the comments or on the Insider Gaming forum.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the news that Gray Zone Warfare is officially an extraction shooter

item.title: EA Adds Microtransactions To Skate’s Closed Alpha
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/ea-adds-microtransactions-to-skates-closed-alpha/

EA has officially added microtransactions to Skate’s latest alpha. In an update message sent out to players, EA teased an “epic gameplay update” along with other “exciting” updates to the game.

One of those updates from developer Full Circle is the addition of microtransactions to the current Closed Alpha playtest. This, according to a message sent to players that has been provided to Insider Gaming.

Known as San Van Bucks, this in-game currency allows players to buy various cosmetic items. According to Full Circle, this is being added to make sure players have a “positive experience when purchasing items from the skate store.”

“To ensure we achieve these goals at Early Access we have enabled the option to purchase and use virtual currency (San Van Bucks) in our ongoing Closed Alpha playtest,” the message to players reads. “Your feedback will be greatly appreciated in providing a great experience at Early Access launch.”

Because the game is still in a playtesting state, it’s mentioned that account progress might be reset at times and will be fully reset before the launch into Early Access. Should you spend any money on San Van Bucks—and, in turn, on items—any purchases you make will be converted back to San Van Bucks and be made available again at the start of Early Access.

To make sure you get them, though, you have to use the same EA account for both playtesting and Early Access.

EA Skate is scheduled to release sometime in 2025. When it does, the game will be free-to-play on PC and console. The game is also expected to come to mobile.

What do you think of EA Skate adding microtransactions during a Closed Alpha test? Let us know down below, and join more discussions in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, check out when Blizzcon is making its comeback. And don’t forget to sign up for our newsletter.

item.title: Best FragPunk Lancers: What Are the Best Lancers in FragPunk?
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/best-fragpunk-lancers/

FragPunk, the newly released tactical hero shooter from Bad Guitar Studio, features a cast of playable characters called Lancers. Each Lancers has their own set of abilities, providing multiple ways for players to utilize and maximize the Shard Cards that make each round unique.

At time of writing, less than a week after the game’s March 6th release, there are 13 playable Lancers in FragPunk. The variety in Lancers means there’s a character for every playstyle, but some are simply stronger than others. Here are the best Lancers in the FragPunk roster right now.

Best FragPunk Lancers

Hollowpoint

Hollowpoint excels at gathering info and holding angles. Her railgun, Meteora, is a single-shot sniper rifle that deals maximum damage after a short charge, and it also recharges ammunition over time. Paparazzi is a trap that automatically attaches to and reveals enemy players, making it super useful when defending sites or catching flankers.

Smoke Screen is a slow-moving source of cover that blocks off wide angles and highlights enemies hit by it. It can be stopped manually as well to close off a chokepoint, and it can go through walls to reveal unsuspecting enemies.

Pathojen

Pathojen is the perfect support Lancer, providing healing to the whole team plus abilities that can hinder attacker plants and defender retakes. Her Emotional Rescue ability is a wide area-of-effect healing ability that heals everyone in range. If your team took damage getting into the site, they can all huddle together and heal before the opposing retake try occurs.

Pathojen can also throw down her Killer Queen trap, which deals damage over time to enemy players after it is triggered or activated manually. Finally, her Shroom Wall can block the enemies from rushing into site or pulling off a quick flank.

Broker

Broker is the very first Lancer you get to play, via the tutorial, but he’s one you should consider sticking with. His most prolific ability is Goddard’s Vengeance, an easy to use but explosive rocket launcher that deals massive damage. 

Cherry Bomb is a very useful ability as well, as it creates a cluster of energy bombs that will pretty much vaporize anyone who touches them. They’re easy to spot and destroy, but even doing so will give Broker players information about where the enemy is coming from. Finally, his Smokestack Lightning ability creates a huge wall of smoke that can provide extensive cover for his whole team.

Corona

If you’re a fan of the duelist class of agents in VALORANT, then Corona is the perfect Lancer for you. Fast Lane, while ironically sharing the name of a Neon ability from Riot’s shooter, is more like Jett’s Dash. Corona can use Fast Lane to dash forwards or upwards, allowing him to get to cover and take space.

Ashes to Ashes is a powerful molotov-like throwable that damages enemies caught in it, but it also provides Corona with damage reduction and a speed boost. In a pinch, Corona can use it on himself to give him the edge in a firefight. Finally, Corona can use Hothead to blind all enemies looking at him after a short charge. This flash ability is so unique compared to traditional thrown blinding abilities that you’re certain to catch numerous enemy players off guard.

For more Insider Gaming coverage, check out the current player count for FragPunk. For more information on player numbers, check out the 2025 player count figures for Call of Duty Warzone, Fortnite, and Marvel Rivals too.
